lyrics:
Morning's come and knocked me flat
With bad TV and all of that
But I have a vision or two
Images of the night before
The bitter walk up to your door
The delicate situation that I blew

We headed down through the town
To your wealthy patron's stomping ground
And he got a drink in for you
Then I saw her in the street
Long black hair and nothing on her feet
Walking with a purpose I've seen in few

She was waving the Spanish Flag

I caught up with the girl
Her flag held tight and then unfurled
In some dance I'd never seen
With a voice warm and low
She asked me if I'd like to go
Out into the fields

We must have walked for a mile
Before she unleashed a smile
And said thanks for taking me home
She started to walk up her path
But something made her turn back
And I said you should be careful out on your own

Then she gave me the Spanish Flag

It lives in the dirt, it lives in the earth
In this ancient land an unfolding plan
Beneath the boughs of a mighty oak
In the charcoal burner's hollow smoke
In the robin's song, in the fallow field
The future is revealed

All these dice loaded, all these men condemned
All this freedom eroded, like the muddy river's bend
And I hear the hammer fall to the floor
I hear your breath pound on these walls like war
And the wind tells me what is in store
And the ground tells me what is in store

And when I held your head in my hands
I knew this was not a good plan
That which I cannot see, and I cannot feel
But a plan it is and so real

The sweet sorrow of knowing, impossible to describe
I witness the darkness that moulds and breaks our lives
That settles over you my love in your dying room
For there is no other reason you could be taken so soon
And I must ask; whose are these hands?
But know that my asking is in the plan

And when I held your head in my hands
I knew this was not a good plan
That which I cannot see, and I cannot feel
But a plan it is and so real

Some black plan, drowning this world

Put your hand in my hand
There's a view I want you to see
The city edge spread out below
The frontier of its victory
And the ground on which we stand
Has become sacred to me
The lights beneath like a shore I know
The ebb and flow of a century

And if this turns out to mean nothing
If this is all a line in the sand
At least we could say we saw some beauty
And that we tried to understand

Juliana, it's all darkness
And we're trying to find our way

Leave the back door open
Let some air in this room
I have dreams unspoken
I have dreams I‘ll never use

We should talk about our future
But let's just watch the swallows fly
In and out of the houses
Each perfect motion in the sky

How long have we been hanging
By this thread?
And if it's strong enough to hold us
Should we care

One bird
With the sun on his wings
In the cherry tree
For you he sings

I've never seen yellow like the yellow in that field
Riding with St. Teresa of the falling trees
And I think I've been in this car before, must have been a dream
No doubt all smoke and echo but this seems real

And she is far from home
And I'm just a boy who can't be alone

While armed forces conspire
To ruin our Saturday nights
We're out of town staring at blue skies
And does this girl exist?
Is this another dream?
And do you think I might be stuck somewhere inbetween?

I've never seen red like the red of those fires
Riding with St. Teresa of the endless smile
I think I've been in this world before, must have been a dream
No doubt all fog and tremolo but this seems real

And she is far from home
And I'm just a boy who can't be alone

While leaders conspire
To suffocate our lives
I'm out of town looking into blue eyes
And does this even exist?
Is this another dream?
You know I think might be caught somewhere inbetween

And what exactly is my hand?
And what do these cards mean?
Have I been dealt more uncertainty?
And St. Teresa laughs, leans her head upon the glass
And says I think we are home at last

The mission's been sidelined
The captain's lost his mind
Living in the past tense
He's not making any sense at all

So we're stuck in the mountains
Locked in our log cabins
Crosses on our doors
Blood on our swords

The sun slowly sinks
Its farewell colours fill the sky
Soon the night will surround us
A world of artificial light

And out there in the woods
Hang all our teenage witches
With their curses and their bells
Passing round handwritten spells
Drinking down their parents riches

So come away from the window
And let your hair down
We can forget about the outside
About the trouble in town

And when you stand like that
You remind me of Lucy
All smiles and wide eyes
Focused on some distant prize
Somehow still looking through me

And do you think you could love me?
And do you think you will forgive me?

You say just put me in a song
Make it the one you say is for the long drive
You say just put me in a song
Make it the one that sounded so tired

You say put me in a song
Make it the one you say is for the long drive
You say put me in a song
Make it the one that sounded so tired

Because I am so tired

Both blue girls
Wearing their halos
Holding hands
All the way down my street
Talking about Baudelaire
How you gotta be drunk on something
And they talk about Verlaine
How his guitar sounds so beautiful

And I'm stuck inside
I feel like Rheticus
Trying to get these words down
But they aren't looking right at all

Polaroids fill my shelves
Just trees and sky
A totally deserted world
And if you want my diary
It's by the door
Between the headphones
And the Commodore 64

It's just blank pages
And some old numbers
You can fill it up
With your thoughts on where I've gone wrong

I can't stop thinking about aeroplanes
I can't stop thinking about Singapore
I can't stop thinking about Jesus Christ
I can't stop thinking about anything

Both blue girls
They're wearing their halos
And they're holding hands
All the way down my street

Sadie's on the faultline waiting for a shift
Down in Southern California where they get the lift
From the East Pacific Rise to San Gabriel peaks
Palmdale and Frazier and aseismic creep

She's on Antelope Valley burning through fuel
‘Cause she heard a rumour – something sacred and cool
Like the Bay and the Point and the shivering dark
She told me about The Catch in Candlestick Park

Somewhere in the desert there's a ticking clock
And when the big one comes that boy won't stop
Up in the mountain, chime for every year
Sounding out pure when we've all disappeared

And Sadie knows running down the fault's spine
We're all just matchflames humbled by time
We need to think in thousands, build something forever
Fire up the lamps, set it down together

She says, "Nations are fictions imposed by our rulers,
The physical map of the world is much cooler."
‘Cause plates will move and we'll all lose
Those tired old flags we didn't choose

White Candle Road
Takes me down to the coast
Two royal daughters in tow
My love lightening my load
I don't need fine wine
To have this good time

Green country night
Giving way to country light
Slow talk about sweet times
Running through golden lives
I don't need to get every colour down
I just need you around

Blue water
Red sky
Silver daughters
Run in the light

Grey clouds rushing in
Pray the sun back again
With speaker blast, we're summoning
Can't you feel the place brightening?
But I don't need control
To make me feel whole

Back down witch: You're not helping
I know which direction they all go to
What we have to do
And are these men?
Each and every one of them?
‘Cause they look like children and there's big boots to be filled in
So back down witch, you can't fight a war like this
With stones and sticks
Some things your spells can't fix

Feels like 1682 – Such a bad year for you
Did they have his protection?
And did he come to you?
At your door in the form of a bird
When he offered you his protection

Good fellows rest
And heed your general's warning
Ready your guns
And we'll set fire to the morning
And they won't know
Those boys won't know
No they won't know
Those boys won't know
For they are used to words
They are used to your words
And words are weak
I will prove myself with a sword
I'll make you feel like…

Wait.
I see a bird.
Wait.
I do see a bird.

The kid's an anti-Stratfordian
Thinks the pyramids were built by aliens
I think the pyramids were built by Africans
It seems to make the most sense

Now I like to hear a conspiracy
As much as the guy sitting next to me
But when we look at the Moon do we see what we want to see?
Or do we just see the Moon?

Sometimes I find
You have to narrow your mind

Back in the Championship days
Before I moved away
It was the city at a push
But some nights the ‘Bridge was enough

I love it when there's no town at all
And it rolls and flows and I'm really not sure
Where this thing begins and ends
Where this thing begins and it ends

Count the lights when you can't see the stars
The blue and the white pressed to our hearts
We count the lights when we can't see the stars
And that's what gets me, pulls me apart

When the grind's got you in its grip
And your wheels just spin in the ditch
Tired of holding up and falling in line
I try to embrace a different time

When we'd count the lights instead of the stars
The blue and the white held to our hearts
We'd count the lights instead of the stars
And that's what gets me, pulls me apart

A good route – we beat the bounds
Keeping within our sacred grounds
I could always hear the trains
And petrol bikes across the plains

And so we made a vow, among the branches away from town
One that binds my heart still

We taught this place held us so well
Marked at its edges by Cross and Bell
We would drink and love
And take comfort in absence above

And once we made a vow, beneath the branches outside of town
One that binds my heart still

A translation for you:
Flowing through Haden is all I do

Who put Bella in the witch elm son?
Who put Bella in the witch elm son?
I don't want you to call them that
I don't want you to call them that
Because they always find a way to come back

Who took Bella's hand my son?
Who cut Bella's hand my son?
Don't you dare call her that
Don't you dare call her that
Because they will find you out my lad

We keep our hearts locked to them all
But we make our mark in chalk upon the wall

I root thru the stacks you put out
Flick thru the racks for stand outs
Gimme photocopied noise from Down Under
Double disc boys with octave pedal thunder

Oh the treehouse kid used to come down
For the pilgrimage into town
I love that old line, the train winds from
The Old Hill to the Snow Hill
Where we set our sights upon

Trinity Records
The Sword kept me flipping, electricity was ripping
All three fade

The Tempest tides served a beating
But with ex-members as guides, my love was increasing
Then to the factory home of true sounds
They said you're never alone when you're underground

At Trinity Records
The Sword kept me flipping, The Dead were kicking
All three fade

You were the songs boy
You got into my bones
And I saw your houses
And they dwarfed my own
And I saw your guitar
Feeding back low
You were the youth boy
The noise at the show

The orange trees, the sunshine
The skaters in the park
The oh-so-cool hair dye
Your Van Halen scars
Back when there was mystery
I got drawn in
Then the harder edges
When you went for the win

I think it was something like that
They all turned their backs
But I can't be sure
On days like these

Somewhere Algeria
Somewhere Tunisia
Somewhere she don't remember
Could've been January
Could've been December
In an old hotel
Why'd you come to me with this?
In an old hotel
Let me take you home
Oh but his hair was long
And he had a girl
And his voice was cracked
He made the sign of the fallen third
And I think he's planning something
They never found a single body
I think he's planning something
That'll make them sorry
And I know you helped her
It was all I could talk about
The cleaning of the fire and how Lucy made it out
I thought he was gone
But I knew he was close
They didn't stop believing
Believing in a ghost
Then I saw him
I saw him

Barmaids of Winchester
Barmaids of Leeds
Beautiful girls with arts degrees
I like nothing better than them talking to me
About Mondrian and American foreign policy

Barmaids of Leicester and Ipswich Town
Lift me up when I'm feeling down
I like nothing better than the sweet, sweet sound
Of their laughter as we try and sink another round

Barmaids of Kensington and Paris, France
Walk on air, they love to dance
But set aside your thoughts of any romance
You've got to understand boy you just don't have a chance

Cuckoo flower and silverweed
Dog rose and meadowsweet
Swallowtail, Apollo, Queen of Spain

Eyebright under nettle tree
Wood white, Camberwell beauty
Swallowtail, Apollo, Queen of Spain

To go lost between the trees
We go lost through the leaves
With Swallowtail, Apollo, Queen of Spain

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
Plegaria A Un Labrador
Levantate y mira la montaña
De donde viene el viento el sol y el agua
Tú que manejas el curso de los rios
Tú que sembraste el vuelo de tu alma

Levantate y mírate las manos
Para crecer estrechala a tu hermano
Juntos iremos unidos en la sangre
Hoy es el tiempo que puede ser mañana

Líbranos de aquel que nos domina en la miseria
Tráenos tu reino de justicia e igualdad
Sopla como el viento la flor de la quebrada
Limpia como el fuego el cañón de mi fusil
Hágase por fin tu voluntad aquí en la tierra
Danos tu fuerza y tu valor al combatir
Sopla como el viento la flor de la quebrada
Limpia como el fuego el cañón de mi fusil

Levantate y mírate las manos
Para crecer estréchala a tu hermano
Juntos iremos unidos en la sangre
Ahora y en la hora de nuestra amén
Amén, amén

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
Te Recuerdo Amanda
Te recuerdo Amanda
la calle mojada
corriendo a la fabrica donde trabajaba Manuel

La sonrisa ancha, la lluvia en el pelo,
no importaba nada
ibas a encontrarte con el,
con el, con el, con el, con el

Son cinco minutos
la vida es eterna,
en cinco minutos

Suena la sirena,
de vuelta al trabajo
y tu caminando lo iluminas todo
los cinco minutos
te hacen florecer

Te recuerdo Amanda
la calle mojada
corriendo a la fabrica
donde trabajaba Manuel

La sonrisa ancha
la lluvia en el pelo
no importaba nada,
ibas a encontrarte con el,
con el, con el, con el, con el

Que partió a la sierra
que nunca hizo daño,
que partió a la sierra
y en cinco minutos,
quedó destrozado

Suenan las sirenas
de vuelta al trabajo
muchos no volvieron
tampoco Manuel

Te recuerdo Amanda,
la calle mojada
corriendo a la fábrica,
donde trabajaba Manuel.

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
A Desalambrar
Yo pregunto a los presentes
Si no se han puesto a pensar
Que esta tierra es de nosotros
Y no del que tenga más

Yo pregunto si en la tierra
Nunca habrá pensado usted
Que si las manos son nuestras
Es nuestro lo que nos den

A desalambrar, a desalambrar
Que la tierra es nuestra
Es tuya y de aquél
De Pedro y María
De Juán y José

Si molesto con mi canto
A alguien que no quiera oír
Le aseguro que es un gringo
O un miembro de este país

A desalambrar, a desalambrar
Que la tierra es nuestra
Es tuya y de aquél
De Pedro y María
De Juán y José

A desalambrar, a desalambrar
Que la tierra es nuestra
Es tuya y de aquél
De Pedro y María
De Juán y José

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
Duerme Duerme Negrito
Duerme, duerme negrito
Que tu  mamá está en el campo
Negrito

Duerme, duerme negrito
Que tu mamá está en el campo
Negrito

Te va a traer codornices para tí
Te va a traer muchas cosas para tí
Te va a traer carne de cerdo para tí
Te va a traer muchas cosas para tí

Y si negro no se duerme
Viene diablo blanco
Y sale comen la patita
Yakapumba Yakapumba
Apumba Yakapumba Yakapumba Yakapumba

Duerme, duerme negrito
Que tu mamá está en el campo
Negrito

Duerme duerme negrito
Que tu mamá está en el campo
Negrito
Trabajando

Trabajando duramente
Trabajando, sí
Trabajando y no le pagan
Trabajando, sí
Trabajando y va cosiendo
Trabajando, sí
Trabajando y va de luto
Trabajando, sí
Pal negrito chiquitito
Trabajando, sí
Pal negrito chiquitito
Trabajando, sí
No le pagan, sí
Duramente, sí
Va cosiendo, sí
Va de luto, sí

Duerme duerme negrito
Que tu mamá está en el campo
Negrito

Duerme duerme negrito
Que tu mamá está en el campo
Negrito

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
A Luis Emilio Recabarren
Pongo en tus manos abiertas mi guitarra de cantor
Martillo de los mineros, arado del labrador

Recabarren, Luis Emilio Recabarren,
simplemente doy las gracias por tu luz.
Con el viento, con el viento de la pampa,
tu voz sopla por el centro y por el Sur.

Árbol de tanta esperanza, naciste en medio del sol.
Tu fruto madura y canta, hacia la liberación.

Recabarren, Luis Emilio Recabarren,
simplemente doy las gracias por tu luz.
Con el viento, con el viento de la pampa,
tu voz sopla por el centro y por el Sur.

Recabarren, Luis Emilio Recabarren,
simplemente doy las gracias por tu luz.
Con el viento, con el viento de la pampa,
tu voz sopla por el centro y por el Sur.

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
Juan Sin Tierra
Voy a cantar el corrido
De un hombre que fue a la guerra
Y anduvo en la sierra herido
Para conquistar su tierra

Lo conocí en la batalla
Y entre tanta balacera
El que es revolucionario
Puede morir donde quiera

El general nos decía
Peleén con mucho valor
Les vamos a dar parcela
Cuando haya repartición

Mi padre fue peón de hacienda
y yo un revolucionario
Mis hijos pusieron tiendas
Y mi nieto es funcionario

Gritó Emiliano Zapata
"¡Quiero tierra y libertad!"
Y el gobierno se reía
Cuando lo íban a enterrar

Vuela Vuela Palomita
Párate en aquella higuera
Que aquí se acaba el corrido
Del mentado Juán sin Tierra

Fragil como un volantin
En los techos de barrancas
Jugaba el niÃ±o Luchin
Con sus manitos moradas

Con la pelota de trapo
Con el gato y con el perro
El cabalo lo miraba

En el agua de sus ojos
Se baÃ±ana el verde claro
Gateaba a su corta edad

Con el potito embarrado
Con la pelota de trapo
Con el gato y con el perro
El caballo lo miraba

El caballo era otro juego
En aquel pequeÃ±o espacio
Y al animal parecia
Le gustaba ese trabajo

Con la pelota de trapo
Con el gato y con el perro
Y con Luchito mojado

Si hay niÃ±os como luchin
Que comen tierra y gusanos
Abramos todas las jaulas
Pa' que vuelen como pajaros

Con la pelota de trapo
Con el gato y con el perro
Y tambien con el caballo

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
Abre Tu Ventana
María, abre la ventana
y deja que el sol alumbre
por todos los rincones
de tu casa.

María, mira hacia fuera
nuestra vida no ha sido hecha
para rodearla de sombras
y tristezas.

María, ya ves
no basta nacer, crecer, amar,
para encontrar la felicidad.

Pasó lo más cruel,
ahora tus ojos se llenan de luz
y tus manos de miel,
tus manos de miel,
tus manos de miel,María.

María, ya ves
no basta nacer, crecer, amar,
para encontrar la felicidad.

Pasó lo más cruel,
ahora tus ojos se llenan de luz
y tus manos de miel,
tus manos de miel,
tus manos de miel, María.

Tu risa brota como la mañana,
brota en el jardín, María.
Tu risa brota como la mañana,
brota en el jardín, María.

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
Preguntas Por Puerto Montt
Muy bien, voy a preguntar, 
por tí, por ti, por aquél 
por ti que quedaste solo 
y el que murió sin saber

Muy bien, voy a preguntar, 
por tí, por ti, por aquél 
por ti que quedaste solo 
y el que murió sin saber,
que murió sin saber

Murió sin saber por qué 
le acribillaban el pecho 
luchando por el derecho 
de un suelo para vivir. 

¡Ay, que ser más infeliz 
el que mandó disparar, 
sabiendo cómo evitar 
una matanza tan vil! 

Puerto Montt, oh Puerto Montt 
Puerto Montt, oh Puerto Montt.

Usted debe responder 
Señor Pérez Zujovic, 
por qué al pueblo indefenso 
contestaron con fusil. 

Señor Pérez, su conciencia 
la enterró en un ataúd 
y no limpiarán sus manos  
toda la lluvia del sur,
toda la lluvia del sur.

Murió sin saber por qué, 
le acribillaban el pecho 
luchando por el derecho  
de un suelo para vivir. 

¡Ay, que ser más infeliz 
el que mandó disparar, 
sabiendo cómo evitar  
una matanza tan vil! 

Puerto Montt, oh Puerto Montt 
Puerto Montt, oh Puerto Montt.

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
El Arado
Aprieto firme mi mano,
y hundo el arao en la tierra
hace años, que llevo en ella
Cómo no estaré agotao?

Aprieto firme mi mano
y hundo el arao en la tierra
hace años que llevo en ella
Cómo no estaré agotao?

Vuelan mariposas, cantan grillos
la piel se me pone negra
y el sol brilla, brilla y brilla
el sudor me hace zurcos,
yo hago zurcos a la tierra sin parar

Vuelan mariposas, cantan grillos
la piel se me pone negra
y el sol brilla, brilla y brilla
el sudor me hace zurcos,
yo hago zurcos a la tierra sin parar

Afirmo bien la esperanza
cuando pienso en la otra estrella
nunca es tarde me dice ella
la paloma volará

Afirmo bien la esperanza
cuando pienso en la otra estrella
nunca es tarde me dice ella
la paloma volará

Vuelan mariposas,cantan grillos
la piel se me pone negra
y el sol, brilla, brilla y brilla

Y en la tarde cuando vuelvo,
en el cielo apareciendo una estrella
nunca es tarde me dice ella
la paloma volará, volará, volará

Cómo yugo de apretao
tengo el puño esperanzao
porque todo cambiará...

Victor Jara
Miscellaneous
Paloma Quiero Contarte
Paloma quiero contarte que estoy solo, que te quiero
Paloma quiero contarte que estoy solo, que te quiero
Que la vida se me acaba porque te tengo tan lejos
Palomita verte quiero

Lloro con cada recuerdo a pesar que me contengo
Lloro con cada recuerdo a pesar que me contengo
Lloro con rabia pa fuera, pero muy ondo pa dentro
Palomita verte quiero

Como trongo de nogal, como la piedra del cerro
Como tronco de nogal, como la piedra del cerro
El hombre pude ser hombre cuando camina derecho
Palomita verte quiero

Como quitarme del alma lo que me dejaron negro
Como quitarme del alma lo que me dejaron negro
Siempre estar vuelto hacia fuera, para cuidarse por dentro
Palomita verte quiero
We do not have the lyrics for Only Thing yet.
